Slides are available via Dropbox [here](https://www.dropbox.com/scl/fi/g2ui6jjnz6f82odifo7b0/topic-sampling.pdf?rlkey=ighkex3iywwvwacazgk1h8ym5&dl=0).

The talk will be an amalgamation of several recent papers, but focus on two in particular:

1. Clifford, Scott and Carlisle Rainey. "The Limits (and Strengths) of Single-Topic Experiments." [[Preprint](https://osf.io/zaykd)]
2. Thorson, Emily and Carlisle Rainey. "The Policy Longevity Bonus: Pre-Analysis Plan." [[Pre-Analysis Plan](https://osf.io/4kjcf)]

The two other relevant papers are below.

- Clifford, Scott, Thomas Leeper, and Carlisle Rainey. "Generalizing Survey Experiments Using Topic Sampling: An Application to Party Cues." Forthcoming in *Political Behavior*. [[Journal](https://doi.org/10.1007/s11109-023-09870-1)] [[Ungated](../../papers/gte.pdf)]
- Clifford, Scott and Carlisle Rainey. "Estimators for Topic-Sampling Designs." Conditionally accepted at *Political Analysis*. [[Preprint](https://osf.io/preprints/socarxiv/7ady6/)]
